items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: Telangana to introduce breakfast scheme in schools like TN: Revanth Reddy
Bengaluru to get adaptive traffic signals at 110 junctions
items.summary: The Karnataka Cabinet approved installation of adaptive traffic signals at 110 busy junctions in Bengaluru city, to ease traffic movement

items.title: Ratmageddon: Why rats are overrunning our cities
items.summary: Rats are multiplying at speed in urban areas. So, what's really behind the boom - and is it now unstoppable?

items.title: Artificial Intelligence and Gaming Lab inaugurated at Government Sri Krishnarajendra Silver Jubilee Technological Institute
items.summary: The Department of Higher Education is working towards enhancing the skills of students in government engineering colleges by providing all facilities available in private educational institutions to government engineering colleges as well

items.title: White House budget office tells agencies to draft mass firing plans ahead of potential shutdown
items.summary: A reduction in force would not only lay off employees but eliminate their positions, which would trigger yet another massive upheaval in a federal workforce that has already faced major rounds of cuts this year.

items.title: BTP staff attend session on stem cell donation as part of blood cancer awareness
Hegseth abruptly summons top military commanders to meeting in Virginia next week
items.summary: The Pentagon's top spokesman, Sean Parnell, confirmed that Mr. Hegseth "will be addressing his senior military leaders early next week.”

items.title: Man sentenced to four year RI for receiving bribe
Religious extremists attacked houses and shops of Ahmadis over burial of woman in Pakistan
items.summary: Although Ahmadis consider themselves Muslims, Pakistan's Parliament in 1974 declared the community to be non-Muslims.

items.title: Revenue officials stage protest
Ecuador prison riot leaves at least 17 dead
items.summary: The riot follows another deadly outbreak earlier this week in a prison in southern Ecuador, where 14 people were killed

items.title: India, Russia discuss BRICS grain exchange plan to boost agriculture trade ties
items.summary: “Discussed ways to strengthen our win-win cooperation in agriculture, fertilizers and food processing,” says Modi  after meeting Russian Deputy Prime Minister Dmitry Patrushev

items.title: Azim Premji declines Karnataka CM’s request to open Wipro campus for public traffic movement
items.summary: In a letter he said that it is “an exclusive private property owned by a listed company, not meant for public thoroughfare.”

items.title: Samaritans facing volunteer exodus over proposed branch closures
items.summary: Opponents fear plans to close more than100 branches could put the charity’s ability to answer calls in doubt.

items.title: A bumpy ride on highways with misery for company
items.summary: Under-construction stretches of NH 544 and NH 66, which have long overshot deadlines, are posing huge problems for motorists as well as those residing near the project sites. Mini Muringatheri interacts with both parties to highlight their plight and the continuing apathy of the authorities

items.title: Butterfly survey conducted
K.M. Shajahan taken into custody
Microsoft disables services to Israel defence unit after review
items.summary: Media reported that an Israeli military surveillance agency used Microsoft’s Azure to store large volumes of mobile phone call recordings from Palestinians

items.title: Delhi court lifts gag order that banned journalist Paranjoy Guha Thakurta from reporting on Adani Enterprises
items.summary: Trial court asked to pass a fresh order in the matter after hearing the applicants on Friday, September 26; Mr. Thakurta not required to follow the gag order till fresh orders passed

items.title: KRV activists detained for disrupting Hindi diwas

items.summary: Curfew clamped in the town, which witnessed violent protests; dozens of people detained; bodies of people killed handed over to families for last rites; at least 15 suffered serious injuries, says DGP

items.title: Dharmasthala case: Court records Chinnaiah’s statement; to continue on Sept. 27
DKS blames ‘misrule’ by erstwhile BJP govt. for Bengaluru’s potholes
'The goal is coming' - Watkins backed to end drought
items.summary: When Morgan Rogers handed Ollie Watkins the ball, the Holte End chanted the striker's name.

items.title: After violent protests, Nepal faces an uneasy road to a democratic future
items.summary: With political parties remaining non-committal about taking part in elections and people lacking confidence, a fragile interim government faces the daunting task of bringing the democratic process back on track; analysts are wary of the government’s capacity to deliver on its mandate to hold electio

items.title: UN expert flags Sri Lankans being trafficked to fight Russia’s war in Ukraine
items.summary: The Russian Ministry of Defence has enlisted foreign nationals to fight in Ukraine, including trafficked persons from Nepal and Sri Lanka, into the Russian army, coercing them into signing contracts through torture and threats to their lives and to their families, the Special Rapporteur said

items.title: Man injured in wild elephant attack near Coimbatore
Martin feels heat again, but are Rangers players letting him down?
items.summary: Russell Martin was again the subject of Rangers fans ire amid the Europa League defeat by Genk, but his players are also to blame, writes Tom English.

items.title: China launches campaign to keep killjoys off the internet
items.summary: Pessimistic social media posts may now be targets of a fresh crackdown by the Chinese government.

items.title: PM compares Burnham's economic proposals to Truss 'disaster'
items.summary: Sir Keir Starmer's comments follow criticism of his leadership from the Mayor of Manchester.

items.title: Digital ID to be compulsory for all UK adults under government plans
items.summary: The prime minister believes a new scheme would help crack down on illegal working in the UK.

items.title: America's gladiator - DeChambeau's road to Ryder Cup talisman
items.summary: Bryson DeChambeau is primed to take centre stage for the United States when the Ryder Cup starts on Friday - but he remains a divisive presence.

items.title: McIlroy & Fleetwood reunite in Ryder Cup foursomes
items.summary: European captain Luke Donald picks a series of heavyweight pairings as he looks for the visitors to make a fast start at Bethpage.

items.title: Where Ryder Cup battle will be won and lost
items.summary: With the past five Ryder Cups won so convincingly on home soil, will Bethpage be any different as the US look to win back the trophy that Europe regained in Rome?

items.title: Dallas shooter intended target to be ICE not detainees - officials
items.summary: One detainee was killed and two others critically injured after a shooting at a Dallas ICE facility on Wednesday.

items.title: Million-year-old skull rewrites human evolution, scientists claim

items.title: High Streets and rundown spaces to get £5bn boost - is your area on the list?
items.summary: Under the Pride in Place programme, 169 communities will get £20m over a decade to spend on boosting their local area.

items.title: Drone attacks leave Denmark exposed - and searching for response
items.summary: In an era of hybrid warfare, there is a sense of embarrassment that Denmark's critical infrastructure has become vulnerable.

items.title: Vinted users furious over InPost UK parcel delays
items.summary: Some users describe parcels not being collected from InPost UK lockers or left stuck in transit.

items.title: From former president to future prisoner: Sarkozy's conviction divides France
items.summary: Sarkozy is back where he used to be – dominating the news and dividing the nation, writes the BBC's Hugh Schofield.

items.summary: Experts have condemned the hack as an "absolute new low" for cyber-crime.

items.summary: Is Andy Burnham really going to start a leadership challenge against the Prime Minister?

items.title: 'They will never ask that question to a man' - Bompastor
items.summary: Chelsea boss Sonia Bompastor says she is "not surprised" a recent survey has found 78% of women had faced discrimination while working in football.

items.title: The battles England need to win in World Cup final
items.summary: What key battles do England need to win in order to beat Canada and lift the Women's Rugby World Cup at Twickenham on Saturday?

items.summary: However, the Harry Potter author appears to rebuff the actress's conciliatory comments.

items.title: Taxi driver who dropped off Southport killer regrets not calling police for 50 minutes
items.summary: The taxi driver who took the Southport attacker to Hart Space did not call 999 for 50 minutes.

items.title: Man who fired on ICE facility hated U.S. government, sought to kill federal agents, say officials
items.summary: The gunman, who fatally shot himself, left behind a note saying that he hoped the attack would “give ICE agents real terror,” said the FBI director

items.title: Ladakh violence: J&K CM Abdullah defends Congress, accuses BJP of blaming others for its failures
items.summary: Mr. Abdullah said the Lieutenant Governor-led Ladakh administration should see why it failed in the first place to take necessary measures to maintain peace

items.title: Rajasthan man arrested on charges of espionage for Pakistan in Jaisalmer
items.summary: Rajasthan CID Intelligence arrests Hanif Khan, a suspected Pakistani spy, for allegedly sharing confidential Indian Army information with Pakistan’s intelligence agency

items.title: Morning Digest: Leh remains tense a day after death of four persons; Trump says he will not allow Israel to annex the West Bank, and more
items.summary: Here is a select list of stories to start the day.

items.title: Trump holds talks with Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif
items.summary: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif was among the top officials from eight Arab or Muslim countries who met with Mr. Trump on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly this week to discuss strategy on ending the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza.

items.title: A rare custom continues: deities are taken to Thiruvananthapuram from  Kanniyakumari
items.summary: A few days before the Navaratri celebrations, a spectacular event takes place in Kanniyakumari district, once part of the erstwhile Travancore. Its history dates back to more than 200 years. Even today, it reminds the local people of the strong cultural bonds between Tamil Nadu and Kerala beyond pol

items.title: A place linked to soldiers for long
items.summary: The Defence Services Staff College was relocated from Quetta, Pakistan, to Wellington only after Independence. But the Nilgiris had a long association with soldiers. The British opened a depot in the mountains for its regiments to convalesce in 1862

items.title: Time is running out for the dolmens of Kodaikanal dating back to 5,000 years
items.summary: Only less than 50% of the dolmens, recorded by Reverend A. Anglade S.J. and Reverend L. V. Newton S.J., are standing in the hills. At Pethuparai, dolmens have been fenced by the Archaeological Survey of India. At Thandikudi, they are vanishing, and some have disappeared under thick vegetation. More

items.title: Terrorism ‘persistent threat’ to development: EAM Jaishankar
items.summary: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar emphasises the need to combat terrorism and reform multilateralism for global stability and development

items.title: WRD fast-tracks dredging of Central Buckingham Canal ahead of northeast monsoon
items.summary: The ₹31-crore project covers dredging of the 7.3-km stretch between Sivananda Salai and R.A. Puram to improve the canal’s flood carrying capacity up to 2,500 cubic feet per second

items.title: Commerce Department at Ethiraj College for Women celebrates its golden jubilee

items.summary: The bench ordered that construction activity should be put on halt within one kilometre of the Pallikaranai Marshland until a study identifying the wetland’s zone of influence is completed

items.title: Kolkata electrocution deaths: Calcutta HC seeks response from government, KMC and CESC
items.summary: Even after 48 hours of deluge, certain areas in Kolkata remained waterlogged and without power supply. Residents of Utsav Utsarg Apartment in Ward No. 109 of the Kolkata Municipal Corporation have been left without power since Tuesday morning.

items.title: Trump says U.S. will impose new tariffs on heavy trucks, drugs and kitchen cabinets

items.title: Trinamool, BJP feud over rainfall data after Kolkata’s deadly downpour
items.summary: As Trinamool cites ‘cumulative’ figure of 1423.2mm of ‘overnight rainfall’, the BJP alleges misrepresentation of rainfall data and a ‘PR circus’

items.title: Southern Railway introduces Janata Khana scheme in Chennai
items.summary: An official says the scheme is aimed at helping unreserved passengers purchase meals without leaving the platform at an affordable price of ₹20; currently, the scheme is operated in 27 stations

items.title: FBI ex-chief James Comey criminally charged as Trump targets critics, source says
items.summary: U.S. President Trump fired Mr. Comey in 2017, early in the Republican President's first term in office.

items.title: Russia accuses NATO, EU of waging 'real war' on it via Ukraine
items.summary: Another clear example is the crisis in Ukraine provoked by the West, through which NATO and the EU have ... already declared a real war on my country and are directly involved in it, says Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov

items.summary: I will not allow Israel to annex the West Bank. I will not allow it. It’s not going to happen, says U.S. President Donald Trump

items.title: Villagers oppose free housing plots allotted to transgender persons in Chengalpattu
Outrage over infant deaths in Indore | In India’s cleanest city, rats in a hospital
items.summary: Two infants died this September after rats bit them in the NICU of a government hospital in Indore, sparking outrage. However, the Madhya Pradesh government claims that the cause of death was pre-existing medical conditions. Mehul Malpani reports on the gaps in hygiene and safety standards in decade

items.title: IAEA says drone detonated near Ukraine's South Ukraine nuclear plant
items.summary: The agency said its team at the site was informed that 22 drones were observed in the plant's monitoring zone late on Wednesday and early on Thursday, with some flying as close as 500 metres.

items.title: Maharashtra rains: CM seeks ‘substantial’ Central assistance

items.summary: The Emergency Communications Center for New Orleans said on its social media page that the outage was due to the cutting of a 911 “fiber line.”

items.summary: Mr. Chautala promised to provide free electricity and double the old age pension on returning to power

items.title:
Delhi govt., IIT Kanpur sign
MoU for artificial rain trials

items.summary: It is essential to American interests that business leaders and policy experts have the opportunity to discuss key issues, address concerns and maintain working relationships with Chinese leaders, says committee President Stephen Orlins

HPV vaccine to be available on Vidal Health’s digital platform
items.summary: The HPV vaccine will be available on Vidal Health’s digital platform. It will enable digital registration, cashless payment and automated tracking of the multi-dose vaccine schedule.
